notesStmt.note: Modern restoration, all the folios stuck on modern paper. Folios missing at the beginning and at the end, and after folios 8 and 18. Many extant leaves are more or less damaged. Last three folios partly damaged.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: Two fragments of Arabic commentaries on the books of Psalms.

supportDesc.extent:
32 folios (+2 modern paper flyleaves at the beginning and at the end). 27 folios
6 folios

collation.p:
3 quires of originally 10 leaves each. Quire 1 and 3 are imperfect.
Fragment of a single quire.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Two different Naskhi hands, with Hebrew square and semi-cursive scripts, of 12th to 14th century. A cursive Naskhi and Hebrew semi-cursive script of approximately 12th to 13th century. An Arabic Naskhi and Hebrew (Oriental) square of approximately 13th to 14th century.

binding.p: BM/BL in-house. Spine title: 'Comm. on Psalms. Arabic. Brit. Mus. Or. 2566.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Moses Wilhelm Shapira (b. 1830, d. 1884), a antiquities dealer of Jerusalem: purchased by the British Museum from him on 08 July 1882, folio [33v].
